attributes.action: set up an e-petition trading scheme to allow for all to have fair access
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
To set up an e-petitions trading scheme – similar to a carbon trading scheme - to counter the abuse of the e-petition system by 'super-users' who by creating a large qty (~100) of petitions which is: a) diluting the e-petition pool and therefore reducing the importance of every other petition; and b) increasing the costs of administering the e-petition system and therefore reducing the likelihood of the system moving past beta-testing.

Therefore, to counter this, each Individual should be issued a maximum qty of 5 e-petition permits. These permits can then be used by the individual or traded through an e-petitions trading scheme to ensure that each individual is given fair access to exercise their democratic right or is compensated accordingly by trading their right to so called 'super-users'.

rejection.details: Comments on e-petitions should be sent to team@petitions.pm.gov.uk
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
